      • getIconLocation

        public String getIconLocation(ContentEntity entity,
                     boolean expanded)
        Description copied from interface: ExpandableResourceType
        Retrieve a reference for the location of the icon for this type. This should be relative to the image library in "/reference/library/src/webapp/image/". For example, the plain-text image is "sakai/text.gif"; If null, other info may be used to find an icon, which may be inappropriate. Implementations of this method should deal with four cases: The collection is empty (in which case the icon will not have an expand action associated with it), the collection is too big to expand (i.e. memberCount > ResourceType.EXPANDABLE_FOLDER_SIZE_LIMIT), the collection is expanded (in which case the "collapse" action is offered), and the collection is collapsed (in which case the "expand" action is offered). The value returned by this method will be used except for the top-level folders within a site. Top-level folders are expanded by default and cannot be collapsed, so the single-parameter getIconLocation(ContentEntity) method is used in that case to get the icon location.
        Specified by:
        getIconLocation in interface ExpandableResourceType
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity for which the icon is needed, or null, especially in cases where a specific entity has not yet been created.
        Returns:
        A path to the icon relative to the root of the image library in "/reference/library/src/webapp/image/", or null

      • getIconLocation

        public String getIconLocation(ContentEntity entity)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Retrieve a reference for the location of the icon for this type. This should be relative to the image library in "/reference/library/src/webapp/image/". For example, the plain-text image is "sakai/text.gif"; If null, the mimetype of the resource or other info may be used to find an icon, which may be inappropriate for a particular resource type. In the case of folders and other expandable resources, the value returned by this method will be used for top-level folders within a site because, those folders are expanded by default.
        Specified by:
        getIconLocation in interface ResourceType
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity for which the icon is needed, or null, especially in cases where a specific entity has not yet been created.
        Returns:
        A path to the icon relative to the root of the image library in "/reference/library/src/webapp/image/", or null

      • getLocalizedHoverText

        public String getLocalizedHoverText(ContentEntity entity,
                           boolean expanded)
        Description copied from interface: ExpandableResourceType
        Access a text string suitable for use as a very brief description of the expand/collapse option for a particular resource. Implementations of this method should deal with four cases: The collection is empty (in which case the icon will not have an expand action associated with it), the collection is too big to expand (i.e. memberCount > ResourceType.EXPANDABLE_FOLDER_SIZE_LIMIT), the collection is expanded (in which case the "collapse" action is offered), and the collection is collapsed (in which case the "expand" action is offered). If the string is more than about 40 or 50 characters, it may be truncated at an arbitrary length. The string may identify the type of this resource or more specific information. If the entity parameter is null, the method should return a more general description of the the entity (suitable for a new entity during creation dialogs). The string should be localized. In addition, the standard getLocalizedHoverText method should be implemented. The text supplied by that method will be used to label the "access" action for the entity.
        Specified by:
        getLocalizedHoverText in interface ExpandableResourceType
        Parameters:
        entity - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:

      • getLocalizedHoverText

        public String getLocalizedHoverText(ContentEntity member)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access a text string suitable for use as a very brief description of a particular resource. If the string is more than about 40 or 50 characters, it may be truncated at an arbitrary length. The string may identify the type of this resource or more specific information. If the entity parameter is null, the method should return a more general description of the the entity (suitable for a new entity during creation dialogs). The string should be localized. If no return value is supplied, a default hover-string will be used.
        Specified by:
        getLocalizedHoverText in interface ResourceType
        Parameters:
        member - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:

      • getActions

        public List<ResourceToolAction> getActions(ResourceToolAction.ActionType type)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access the action specified by the parameter. If the action is defined for this resource type, it is returned. Otherwise, the method returns null.
        Specified by:
        getActions in interface ResourceType
        Returns:

      • getActions

        public List<ResourceToolAction> getActions(List<ResourceToolAction.ActionType> types)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access an ordered list of actions specified by the parameter. The actions are added to the list in the order specified by the parametric list. If none of the action types specified in the list are defined for this resource type, the returned list will be empty.
        Specified by:
        getActions in interface ResourceType
        Returns:

      • hasRightsDialog

        public boolean hasRightsDialog()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Should the Resources tool elicit copyright/licensing for items of this type?
        Specified by:
        hasRightsDialog in interface ResourceType
        Overrides:
        hasRightsDialog in class BaseResourceType
        Returns:
        true if the copyright/licensing dialog is included among the resource properties in the UI, false otherwise.

      • allowAddAction

        public boolean allowAddAction(ResourceToolAction action,
                     ContentEntity entity)
        Description copied from interface: ExpandableResourceType
        Determine whether users should be able to perform a particular action to create new resources in a particular collection. This provides a way for the type registration to disallow creation of entities within ContentEntity instances that are of that ResourceType.
        Specified by:
        allowAddAction in interface ExpandableResourceType
        Parameters:
        action - An action to create a ContentEntity of a particular ResourceType.
        entity - An instance of a ContentEntity whose type is this ExpandableResourceType.
        Returns:
